intro: Hieracium ullepitschii, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. It features bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium ullepitschii is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
